thread.title: Lady Tigers down Elizabeth in Hall of Fame game
thread.title_full: Lady Tigers down Elizabeth in Hall of Fame game

author: Daniel Green
title: Lady Tigers down Elizabeth in Hall of Fame game
text: Lady Tigers down Elizabeth in Hall of Fame game PITKIN — The Elizabeth Lady Bulldogs were in control early. Comment Posted Oct. 25, 2015 at 7:30 PM PITKIN — The Elizabeth Lady Bulldogs were in control early. But the Pitkin Lady Tiger press proved to be too much in the second half as the home crowd left happy from the Pitkin Hall of Fame Classic as the Lady Tigers downed the Lady Bulldogs, 51-35. It was a balanced effort from Pitkin, who has six players score at least five points in the contest, five of those scoring at least eight points, much to the pleasure of veteran head coach Dana Wisby. Elizabeth was able to jump out to a 12-11 lead at the end of the first period as Haiden Perry dominated in the post. Using her 6-foot frame to her advantage, Perry scored seven points in the opening stanza. Hali Thompson gave Pitkin a 14-12 lead to open the second with a three-pointer, but a Perry basket tied it up at 14-14. But the Lady Tigers got five points from both Shelby Lentz and Brianne Perkins during a 14-4 run, while saw Pitkin take a 28-18 lead into the halftime intermission. It was all Pitkin in the third quarter as Emily Hardisty, Brilee Nolen and Madison McDonald proved to be effective getting to the basket and scoring, allowing the Lady Tigers to open up a 49-29 lead going into the final eight minutes. The fourth period was very sloppy for both teams as Pitkin held on for the win. Perkins led the Lady Tigers with 11 points, while Nolen finished with 10 points. Lentz chipped in with nine points, while Hardisty and McDonald each added eight points. Thompson notched five points. Perry finished with nine points to pace the Lady Bulldogs, while Katie Jo McBride accounted for seven points. Elizabeth Bulldogs……65 Pitkin Tigers…..47 The Elizabeth Bulldogs took advantage of some early turnovers and never looked back in defeating the Pitkin Tigers in the final game of a quadruple-header on Thursday night at the Pitkin Hall of Fame Classic, 65-47. Chase Hurst and Tyler LaFauci were the key scorers early on for the Bulldogs as they managed to build a 17-9 lead over the Tigers, who got five points from Cody Bailey in the frame. The second quarter provided an opportunity for the Bulldogs to pull away and they did just that. Getting five points from Trey Maddox and nine points from Hurst as Elizabeth went into the locker room with a commanding 36-18 advantage. Braydon Doyle came to life in the second half for the Tigers, who were able to match Elizabeth over the final 16 minutes of play. However, it wasn’t enough as the Bulldogs got the victory. Hurst paced the Bulldogs with 20 points, while LaFauci notched 14 points. Tanner Paul and Kolby Friday had eight and seven points, respectively. Page 2 of 2 - Doyle led the Tigers with 16 points, while Bailey chipped in with 14 points.
